qas.question: What book did John Gleck write about Feynman?
Why did Feynman lose credit for his writing?

context: Feynman was a keen popularizer of physics through both books and <a4_0>lectures<a4_0/>, including a 1959 talk on top-down nanotechnology called <a0_0><b5_0>There's Plenty of Room at the Bottom<b5_0/><a0_0/>, and the three-volume publication of his undergraduate <b9_0>lectures<b9_0/>, <a1_0><b6_0>The Feynman Lectures on Physics<b6_0/><a1_0/>. Feynman also became known through his semi-autobiographical books <a2_0><b7_0>Surely You're Joking, Mr. Feynman!<b7_0/><a2_0/> and What Do You Care What Other People Think? and books written about him, such as Tuva or Bust! and <a3_0><b8_0>Genius: The Life and Science of Richard Feynman<b8_0/><a3_0/> by James Gleick.
